alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa Coastal; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 7:20AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Okaloosa and southeastern Santa Rosa Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 620 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Bagdad to 10 miles north of Navarre to 3 miles northeast of Navarre Beach. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wright, Fort Walton Beach, Eglin AFB, Milton, Valparaiso, Mary Esther, Bagdad, Ocean City, Lake Lorraine, Navarre, Cinco Bayou, Point Baker, Roeville and Navarre Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
